title: 3D Imaging and Spectroscopy of Complex Biological Systems at the Sub-Cellular, Cellular and Multicellular Levels
content: The non-invasive nature of optical microscopy enables us to study a great variety of materials under conditions approaching or similar to their "natural" environment. This is especially relevant to live biological specimens, which can be studied both in-vitro and in-vivo, providing a unique insight into the dynamic processes occurring in the live organisms.
